H0.text: Migration is the term used when entire communities in an ecosystem change over time.

H1.text: Extinction is the process by which entire communities in an ecosystem change over time.

H2.text: Overpopulation is the term used when entire communities in an ecosystem change over time.

H3.text: Ecological succession is when entire communities in an ecosystem change over time.

A4.text: Ecological succession is the process of how species compositions change in an ecological community over time.
